content.description: Sit start under the steepness and head straight up to an easy slab finish.
content.location: This ascends the far right arete in the steep cave that faces the street.

content.description: Crouch start as for the problem Apocalyse and move up to match on a small crimp, then pop way far left with virtually no feet to a decent slot and top out.
content.location: Start as for the problem Apocalyse.

content.description: Stand start the slopey twin aretes.
content.location: This is about 5-6 feet right of the problem Apocalyse.

content.description: Sit start using the good, low feature for your right hand (the same start hold as for the problem Journey), and move left to the arête proper. Get situated on small holds, then bump up to a small, right, black divot, and then reach left around the arête to a tiny, left hand button. Move up the arête eventually getting the good angled left hand bar, and top out. I am waiting for consensus on the grade.
content.location: This ascends the dead obvious, stunning 13 foot arête. Start about 6 feet right of the tire.

content.description: Low sit start with left hand on good horizontal flat rail and right hand on a crimp low in the horizontal seam below the 72 spray painted on the boulder. Move left hand up to really cool blocky pinch, surf right hand to poor sloper, pop left hand up the arête, get right hand on a side pull crimp and move up and top out.
content.location: This is the steep, undercut arête on the right side of the steepest boulder with some black spray painted letters on it.

content.description: Sit start matched with a good, low feature about 4-5 feet right of the arete and move right to a cool, flat, horizontal sloper. Use the left arete and face to reach the top.
content.location: This is the obvious, steep prow.

content.description: Crouch start with small feet and move up  and match on a small crimp, move right around the arête to top out.
content.location: This is on the block roughly in the middle of the area.

content.description: These are a group of 5-6 blocks.
